newsitem.title: USA: Microsoft unveils Explorer for Macintosh. [CORRECTED 03:19 GMT 7/11]
newsitem.headline: Microsoft unveils Explorer for Macintosh. [CORRECTED 03:19 GMT 7/11]

text.p: Microsoft Corp said Tuesday it released a version of its Internet browser designed for Apple Computer Inc.'s Macintosh personal computers.
"Roughly one out of four Internet users accesses the Internet from a (Macintosh-based) computer," said Heidi Roizen, Apple's vice president of developer relations.
Microsoft said its Internet Explorer software for Macintosh computers, was now available worldwide.

Previously, the software company had only released a version of Internet Explorer 3.0 for the Windows and Windows 95 systems. (Corrects to clarify that an earlier Macintosh version had been available.)
The software can be downloaded for free from Microsoft's World Wide Web site (http://www.microsoft.com/ie/).
